author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: يا إِلهِي مَعَ عِلْمِيْ وَإِيقانِي بِأَنَّ ذِكْرَ دُونِكَ لَنْ يَصِلَ إِلَيْكَ وَثَناءَ غَيْرِكَ لا يَتَعارَجُ إِلى سَمآءِ قُرْبِكَ، لَوْ أَصْمُتُ مِنْ ثَنائِكَ وَبَدائِعِ ذِكْرِكَ لَيَحْتَرِقُ كَبِدِيْ وَتَذُوبُ نَفْسِيْ، بِذِكْرِكَ يا إِلهِي يَسْكُنُ عَطَشِيْ وَيَسْتَرِيحُ
translation: By Thy glory, O my God! Though I recognize and firmly believe that no description which any except Thyself can give of Thee can beseem Thy grandeur, and that no glory ascribed to Thee by any save Thyself can ever ascend into the atmosphere of Thy presence, yet were I to hold my peace, and cease to glorify Thee and to recount Thy wondrous glory, my heart would be consumed, and my soul would melt away.
